title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Build your first GraphRAG Powered Agent! (No Graph Expert Required) | Databases for AI

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the session explains how to unlock knowledge trapped in documents, PDFs, and wikis by using knowledge graphs and common AI tools. It promises a live demo that shows you can build a useful knowledge graph in an afternoon rather than a months-long project.
bullets: Knowledge in docs, PDFs, and wikis is often unusable by models without structured representation.
Knowledge graphs can unlock that hidden information for better reasoning.
Many teams avoid building graphs because it sounds daunting.
The talk demonstrates a practical, fast approach using AI tools you likely already use.
Live demo with real documents — no six-month project required.
takeaways: Faster access to operational knowledge in manuals, runbooks, and specs can speed troubleshooting and decision cycles.
Building a knowledge graph can be a short, practical project rather than a long, costly initiative — reducing time-to-value.
Leverages existing AI tools and current documentation, lowering integration and skills barriers for deployment.
Rapid prototyping (an afternoon demo) allows you to validate benefits before committing larger resources.

items.title: Watch Live: Fed Chair Jerome Powell Holds News Conference | WSJ

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell speaks to reporters following the Federal Reserve's two-day policy-setting meeting. The WSJ News video covers his post-meeting news conference live.
bullets: Live news conference with Fed Chair Jerome Powell
Occurring immediately after the Fed's two-day policy-setting meeting
Presented by WSJ News (video published Jan 27, 2026)
Features Powell speaking to reporters following the policy meeting
takeaways: Watch the live event or recording to identify any statements that might have implications for economic conditions relevant to demand and financing.
Be prepared to have finance and operations teams ready to assess and translate any post-meeting developments into planning or budget adjustments.
Monitor market and energy-price reactions after the conference and update short-term demand forecasts and contingency plans if needed.

items.title: Deutsche Bank accelerates Cloud journeys with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Google Cloud Consulting helped Deutsche Bank design novel learning experiences that used Generative AI to deliver personalized, interactive training and made thousands of engineers fluent in cloud engineering. The program blended on‑demand convenience with instructor‑led effectiveness, and the Google Cloud Consulting Learning Services team supplied the creative innovation and technical expertise to build the Deutsche Bank Cloud Engineering Program and accelerate their cloud journey.
bullets: Generative AI used to create personalized, interactive training experiences.
Training combined on‑demand learning with instructor‑led sessions for effectiveness.
Program helped thousands of engineers become fluent in cloud engineering.
Google Cloud Consulting Learning Services provided creative innovation and technical expertise.
Built the Deutsche Bank Cloud Engineering Program to accelerate the bank's cloud journey.
takeaways: Upskilling thousands of engineers can materially accelerate a large organization's cloud migration timeline.
Generative AI enables personalized, scalable training that can raise workforce cloud fluency faster.
A hybrid on‑demand plus instructor‑led approach can improve training effectiveness during large platform transitions.
Partnering with specialized consulting teams provides the creative and technical resources needed to deploy large-scale cloud learning programs.

items.title: Year-end toolkit: Strengthening audit committee collaboration

ai.summary: Based on the available description… This episode in PwC’s year-end toolkit series focuses on strengthening collaboration between finance teams and the audit committee across the year-end accounting and reporting process. It highlights key year-end issues, oversight of AI and cyber risk, enterprise risk management, transformation initiatives, and elevating proxy disclosures.
bullets: Strengthening management/audit committee communication and collaboration (1:18)
Key year-end accounting and reporting issues finance teams should be ready to address (10:10)
Oversight of AI: risks, opportunities, and required controls (15:02)
Enhancing enterprise risk oversight and addressing transformation initiatives (21:33 & 27:35)
Elevating proxy disclosures for governance and investor communication (36:05)
takeaways: Prepare concise, audit-committee-focused reporting on AI programs — be ready to discuss risks, controls, and opportunities.
Anticipate heightened scrutiny of cyber risk in the age of AI; ensure cyber controls and oversight are documented for committee review.
Streamline year-end disclosures and governance materials so management can efficiently address the committee’s packed agenda.
Link transformation initiatives to enterprise risk reporting so the audit committee can assess impact on controls and financial reporting.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video shows Jo discovering the power of Copilot Groups to make route planning easy. The short description frames the topic with the hashtags #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai.
bullets: Route planning made easy is the central message.
Jo is presented as discovering Copilot Groups.
The description emphasizes the "power" of Copilot Groups.
Hashtags highlight Copilot and AI as the context.
takeaways: Consider evaluating Copilot Groups as a tool to simplify route planning for field and logistics teams.
Pilot Copilot Groups on a small routing use case to assess fit and workflow impact.
Use the video as a brief introduction to Copilot Groups’ routing capabilities for stakeholders.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the podcast episode explains that AI is already embedded in modern audit practice at KPMG, supporting repetitive tasks, large-scale data analysis, and decision-making. Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska outline practical AI tools (e.g., AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI) and platforms (KPMG Clara), the benefits for clients, changing auditor competencies, and considerations such as data security and regulatory challenges.
bullets: AI is used for repetitive tasks, analyzing full populations of data, and improving audit decision-making.
Tools discussed include AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI (conversational assistant and specialized agents), and the KPMG Clara platform.
Shift from sampling to full-population analysis enabled by technology.
AI supports documentation, disclosure analysis, real-time audit management, and client communication (Clara for Clients).
Adoption challenges include auditor adaptation, data security, regulatory environment, and potential AI-related risks.
takeaways: Expect audits to leverage full-population data analysis — ensure data accessibility, quality, and logging to support deeper automated review.
Prioritize data security and regulatory compliance when integrating AI tools, as these are highlighted implementation considerations.
Support auditor and operational staff training in AI-related competencies to enable effective use of new tools and workflows.
Design systems for real-time data exchange and audit platform integration to streamline client communication and audit management.
